intro: Cyrtandra vestigii, commonly known as the Hawaiian mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and stream banks. Cyrtandra vestigii has small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, supporting various pollinators and contributing to the biodiversity of Hawaiian flora.
